meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.a: The Best Traveler Photos Of The Year According To National Geographic

div.div: These are all simply astounding. Even more astounding, none were Instagrammed.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OYfGfQ&via=Digg&text=The Best Traveler Photos Of The Year According To National Geographic

div.div: A crucial test for the Air Force’s experimental Mach-5 missile has ended in failure, according to the Air Force. Tuesday’s test is also the third time the hypersonic X-51A Waverider cruise missile has fallen short. But this time could be the last.

div.a: Windows 8 Review: Incredibly Innovative, Incredibly Important, Not Quite Incredible

div.div: Why does Windows 8 matter? Ha! Ha ha ha ha ha. Simply, this is the first time that you will have to re-learn how to use Windows on a basic level since 1992. Windows is the most central piece of software in the world, and it is undergoing a major paradigm shift. It's the New Deal, for PCs.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/N0j9Po&via=Digg&text=Windows 8 Review: Incredibly Innovative, Incredibly Important, Not Quite Incredible

div.a: From Robot Trader To Computer Overlord?

div.div: If a computer glitch lost Knight Capital $440m, how long will it be before high-frequency trading computers threaten the stability of the civilised world?

div.a: Restaurant Offers Discount For Checking Your Cellphone

div.div: A Los Angeles restaurant looks to break down the walls that seem to be getting in the way of the intimate dining experience by offering a 5% discount to patrons who check their phone at the door.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PpBa5R&via=Digg&text=Restaurant Offers Discount For Checking Your Cellphone

div.a: Brain Scans Explain The Power Of Bruce Lee's One-Inch Punch

div.div: Lee was undoubtedly at the peak of his physical potential, but research has now shown his ability to punch so hard from so close could be better explained by his brain structure than his strength.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NlRxzr&via=Digg&text=Brain Scans Explain The Power Of Bruce Lee's One-Inch Punch

div.a: 80% Of Public Schools Have Contracts With Coke Or Pepsi

div.div: Starting in the early '90s, cash-strapped public schools began selling exclusive "pouring rights" to one or another Big Soda company, which would then supply all the beverages sold in on-site snack bars, stores, and soda machines as well as at sports events. Along with sugary drinks, of course, the companies also stuffed the schools with plenty of advertisements.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PY0iPb&via=Digg&text=80% Of Public Schools Have Contracts With Coke Or Pepsi

div.a: Why Isn't There An Arabic Word For 'Gay?'

div.div: In Arabic, there is no exact word to say "homosexual." People use bad words like faggot, pervert, or just use the sentence "liking people from same sex." Recently, a few people started using the word "mithli" modifying the word for "sex" -- meaning "same as me."

li.div: persecuted RT @TheAtlantic: Is there a word for 'gay' in Arabic? theatlantic.com/national/a...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PnX8JI&via=Digg&text=Why Isn't There An Arabic Word For 'Gay?'

div.a: Obama Obsessed With White House Beer

div.div: President Obama likes beer — so much so that the White House has installed a new feature since he took office: a brewery.

li.div: Ok, intarwebz, make me proud...Someone with pull needs to get me into the White House brewery washingtonpost.com/politic...

div.a: Eric Schmidt's Mansion Afflicted By The Curse Of Kim Kardashian

div.div: Eric Schmidt, former CEO of Google, was doing just fine — until Kim Kardashian came along to ruin his real estate business.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NCbtgP&via=Digg&text=Eric Schmidt's Mansion Afflicted By The Curse Of Kim Kardashian

div.a: How Many Colors Are Really In A Rainbow?

div.div: You might think — off the top of your head — that the answer is infinity; why wouldn’t you be able to just have an infinite number of frequencies that occur in that range?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/R1DfYC&via=Digg&text=How Many Colors Are Really In A Rainbow?

div.a: Watch Cute Animals Shake Themselves Dry In The Name Of Science

div.div: When shaking, mammals can generate centrifugal forces 10-70 times gravity and some can shed 70% of water in 4 seconds.

li.div: Animals shaking themselves free of water. Some of the most adorable science you've ever seen. youtube.com/watch?v=AFzWJ6...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/R1K5xo&via=Digg&text=Watch Cute Animals Shake Themselves Dry In The Name Of Science

div.a: Judge: 'Friends' Can Share Your Facebook Profile With The Government

div.div: A court has ruled that investigators can go through your Facebook profile if one of your friends gives them permission.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/N3yloZ&via=Digg&text=Judge: 'Friends' Can Share Your Facebook Profile With The Government

div.div: The company is looking to open 100 locations of a hotel chain.

div.a: The Many (But Mostly Sad) Moods Of Lana Del Rey

div.div: Through a series of mood rings, this infographic explores Lana Del Rey's unique expressiveness in five of her videos. Hint: She's pretty much always sad.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/MXqBL2&via=Digg&text=The Many (But Mostly Sad) Moods Of Lana Del Rey

div.a: 'Simpsons' Writers Pick Their Favorite Obscure Characters

div.div: According to the Simpsons Wikia, after 23 seasons there are now 1,612 characters in The Simpsons’ universe, from major to minor to celebrities just passing through for a voice cameo. The show's writers picked their ten favorites.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PoSKXz&via=Digg&text='Simpsons' Writers Pick Their Favorite Obscure Characters

div.a: Curiosity's Latest High-Res Photo Looks Like Earth

div.div: The Curiosity rover seems to be eagerly looking ahead at its eventual target, Mount Sharp, in this new color photo taken with the probe’s Mast cameras.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NzoU4F&via=Digg&text=Curiosity's Latest High-Res Photo Looks Like Earth

div.div: Because nobody wants to hear about that band they've probably never heard of.

li.div: Since hipsters never think they're hipsters, I'm not sure how you ban "talking about annoying hipster topics." sfist.com/2012/08/14/four_barr...

div.a: How Do You Defend Yourself Against A Rampaging Kangaroo?

div.div: In case you weren't aware, kangaroos can be vicious. If you ever find yourself alone in a dark alley with one, here's what you need to know to survive.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ox8dbP&via=Digg&text=How Do You Defend Yourself Against A Rampaging Kangaroo?
